data.title: The 50+ Best NBA Charlotte Hornets Centers
data.meta_description: Over 200 sports fans have voted on the 50+ Best NBA Charlotte Hornets Centers. Current Top 3: Alonzo Mourning, Vlade Divac, Al Jefferson
data.text:
COLLECTION6 LISTS

Charlotte HornetsLists that rank the team's greatest players and coaches, now and throughout history.

The 50+ Best NBA Charlotte Hornets Centers

Ranked By

1.4K votes

287 voters

3 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Charlotte Hornets.

Big fan of Charlotte basketball? Then check out this list of Charlotte Hornets centers. It includes almost every center from throughout Charlotte Hornets and Bobcats history, including current centers and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA centers of all time, the best Hornets Cs include Alonzo Mourning, Elden Campbell, Al Jefferson, and Emeka Okafor.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Charlotte Hornets starting Cs and backup Cs are Mason Plumlee, Nick Richards, and Kai Jones.

Who are the best centers in Charlotte Hornets history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Charlotte big men of all time!

Most divisive: Joel Przybilla

Over 200 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 50+ Best NBA Charlotte Hornets Centers

Birthplace : USA, Virginia

Team : Miami Heat, Brooklyn Nets, Charlotte Hornets

Position : Center

Hornets Seasons: 1992-1995

Alonzo Mourning's tenure with the Charlotte Hornets began when he was drafted as the second overall pick in 1992, instantly establishing himself as a dominant force in the center position. With an aggressive, shot-blocking style of play, Mourning became the cornerstone of the Hornets' defense during his time with the team. In addition to his strong defensive performance, he was also a significant offensive contributor, earning two All-Star selections and an All-NBA Third Team nod in 1995. Mourning's reputation as one of the best Charlotte Hornets centers of all time is well-deserved, given his combination of skill and tenacity on the court.

Birthplace : Prijepolje, Serbia

Team : Sacramento Kings, Charlotte Hornets, Los Angeles Lakers

Position : Center

Hornets Seasons: 1996-1998

Vlade Divac joined the Charlotte Hornets in 1996 through a trade, immediately proving to be a valuable asset to the team. A versatile player, Divac was known for his exceptional passing skills and basketball IQ, which allowed him to contribute significantly to both the offensive and defensive aspects of the game. During his tenure with the Hornets, he earned the nickname "The Yugoslavian Magician" for his uncanny ability to facilitate plays and find open teammates. Divac's unique style of play and all-around contribution to the team undoubtedly earns him a spot on the list of the best Charlotte Hornets centers of all time.

Birthplace : Monticello, Mississippi

Team : Utah Jazz

Position : Power forward, Center

Hornets Seasons: 2013-2016

In 2013, Al Jefferson signed with the Charlotte Hornets, quickly becoming an integral part of the team's success. Known for his low-post scoring abilities and excellent footwork, Jefferson played a pivotal role in elevating the Hornets' offense. His impressive performances during his time in Charlotte earned him an All-NBA Third Team selection in 2014, along with the title of NBA Eastern Conference Player of the Month in December of the same year. Al Jefferson's expertise and finesse on the court solidifies his standing as one of the top centers in Charlotte Hornets history.

Birthplace : Houston, Texas, USA

Team : New Orleans Hornets

Position : Power forward, Center

Hornets Seasons: 2004-2009

Selected with the second overall pick in the 2004 NBA Draft, Emeka Okafor proved to be a powerful force for the Charlotte Hornets. Known for his shot-blocking and rebounding abilities, he was a consistent presence on both ends of the floor. During his rookie season, Okafor earned the NBA Rookie of the Year award, making him one of the most accomplished Charlotte centers in history. His exceptional play in the early years of the franchise is what makes him a standout among the best Charlotte Hornets centers of all time.

Birthplace : Atlanta, Georgia

Team : Los Angeles Lakers

Position : Center

Hornets Seasons: 2017-2018

A seasoned veteran when he joined the Charlotte Hornets in 2017, Dwight Howard brought an impressive presence to the team's center position. Known for his incredible athleticism and imposing physique, Howard was a force to be reckoned with on both ends of the floor. His rebounding and shot-blocking skills added a strong defensive component to the team, while his ability to score in the paint contributed significantly to the Hornets' offense. Although his time with the Hornets was brief, Dwight Howard's impact earns him a place among the best centers in Charlotte history.

Birthplace : Hanford, California

Team : Houston Rockets

Position : Center

Hornets Seasons: 2009-2010

After being traded to the Charlotte Hornets in 2009, Tyson Chandler quickly became a vital component of the team's defense. Standing at 7'1", his intimidating size and exceptional shot-blocking abilities made life difficult for opponents in the paint. In addition to his stellar defense, Chandler was also a relentless rebounder and an efficient scorer around the basket. His overall defensive prowess during his time in Charlotte cements his place as one of the best centers in franchise history.
